message.content:
cs.HC, cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.GR, cs.MM 

The paper presents a controlled study comparing interaction with a haptically enhanced mixing board against interaction with a mouse in an abstract task. The study focuses on the interaction between humans and computers, specifically in the area of human-computer interaction (HCI), which falls under the category of Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC). The paper also discusses the use of sliders and parameter space exploration, which are relevant to Information Retrieval (cs.IR) and Social and Information Networks (cs.SI). The study involves the use of graphical sliders, which are relevant to Graphics (cs.GR), and the use of motion path data, which is relevant to Multimedia (cs.MM).
